text:
Hi! I'm new here. I'm developing an app that will fetch all tickets associated with an account. I found this resource
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/objects/tickets/v1#get-all-tickets>
which suggests that I need to specify the properties I want for the returned tickets to contain.
Please help with the following:
1. Is this the case?
2. Where can I see a comprehensive list of properties, from which to choose?
3. Is there a "Ticket Summary" property?
Thank You!!
Hi guys i need some help
when i am trying to apply in Impact awards then I am getting errors how can I  resolve that..

Hi everyone,
I'm working on tracking email events through the HubSpot API using the following endpoint:
`<https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events?recipient=xyz@abc.com&eventType=SENT&limit=100>`
My approach is to use the `sentBy` ID as a unique key to match events for `OPEN`, `DELIVERED`, and `SENT`. For example, if the `sentBy` ID appears in both `SENT` and `DELIVERED` or `OPEN` events, it indicates that the email was first sent, then successfully delivered, and eventually opened by the client.
However, I am encountering a discrepancy where HubSpot UI shows the event as "DELIVERED", but according to my logic, it should be marked as "OPEN".
Can anyone help resolve this issue, or should I consider using a different API or approach to track these email events more accurately?

so we're actively reworking the GET threads/ api right now. You can filter by thread status with the existing API (most of the time), but you can't do anything like filter on threads whose status's have changed most recently
which it sounds like is what you want
We can look to expose a sort on an updatedAt field for the new API. My only concern is that it will reflect a lot of updates people don't care about
Regardless, we'll make sure to look into this for the new API since it's a low lift for us

Ok devs... I have a SUPER strange bug I need some more brainpower for and am hoping someone can help me out. To be clear, I don't think this is a bug I created. I think this might be a platform bug. :eyes2:

I have a deal and it has line items, aircraft, contact, and company associated objects. Hitting the API, I can pull associated contacts, line items, and aircraft. When I try to grab associated company, HS returns an empty set
